TopicTitle: How often do you read someone's signature?

Articles.Content: Every time adding someone's big images to AdBlock list or looking for a reason to "ban" in the "Ban the user" forum game thread.
Whenever I mistake it for part of their message for some reason.

When I'm curious about their mod or a challenge they did.

Or when I'm hiding it because the new forum layout doesn't force signatures to be small anymore.
Almost never, because signatures don't display on mobile.

Nobody reads my signature.

Because it's in small font, white on white.
Only twice I've read someone's signature. And that was when I was browsing the forums on my pc in a rare instance, and both times were on the same day. So that explains a lot.

The Aziz has a hilarious signature and I always get a crack out of reading it.

AlamoVampire's signature basically looks like what I would put if the whole KSP ribbons thing was prettier.

Master39's is always eyecatching.
Depends on how long is it. If it's brief and simple then there's more reason to read it off. (esp. to the godly mod creators.)
If it contains large letters and bright colors of course im going to read it
Based on the number of times I have to tell people how to get support, and it's in my sig, not very often for most people
The sig tells a lot about a person and I use it to gauge how much they do stuff on the forums.
